content: Alexandra Romanova is a student of applied mathematics at the RUDN University. Her research interests include simulation, probability theory, mathematical statistics, financial mathematics, analytics. She is a member of the research group, which trying to solve applied tasks.
summary: Alexandra Romanova is a student of applied mathematics at the RUDN University. Her research interests include simulation, probability theory, mathematical statistics, financial mathematics, analytics. She is a member of the research group, which trying to solve applied tasks.
title: Alexandra Romanova

summary: The object of the research when writing this work was the Russian market of financial derivatives. The study focused on options and futures traded on the Moscow Exchange. In the process of writing my final qualifying work, I investigated mathematical models for evaluating the value of options, which are currently used by all financial analysts. With the help of the investigated methods, the option values were calculated and the corresponding forecasts for the future were given. The main conclusions are made, the results are summed up.
title: Mathematical methods for evaluating derivatives
